mods.abstract: ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS REWARD--The sum of One Hundred Dollars will be paid by the undersigned for the arrest and safe delivery, or lodgement in any jail in Louisiana, of my slaves DAN and BEN, who ran away or were stolen from my place in Terrebonne parish, on the night of the 4th inst. Dan is a black, about 5 feet 8 inches in stature, is well proportioned, has a good countenance and is 28 years of age. Ben is also a black, is about 5 feet 7 inches in stature, stoutly built, has a good countenance and is 25 years of age. he has several large scars on the top and back of his head and speaks with a rather feminine voice. G.L. LESTER, Houma, Terrebonne parish, La. jy23 6t&4tW*
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
